intro: Acidoton venezolanus, commonly known as the Venezuelan acid tree, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions with high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
